oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of allegiance of William C. Huddleston
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William C. Huddleston signed this oath of allegiance to the United States, with a bond of $300, when he was about 65 years old. John Sellars signed as surety. The reverse side contains a guarantee of protection with the names of Andrew Johnson, Military Governor of Tennessee, and Major Gen. W. S. Rosecrans, Dept. of the Cumberland.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
